author: Staff Reporter
text:
Poultry farmers should use dry feeds as prevailing temperatures during day and night is likely to affect the feed intake of birds.

A release from Agromet Field Unit of Veterinary College and Research Institute and Regional Meteorological Centre, Chennai, said that the maximum and minimum temperature will respectively be 33 degree Celsius and 22 degree Celsius.

The temperature during day increases with oscillating night temperature and the late winter weather condition will continue for one or two weeks. To sustain egg production, farmers should ensure mycotoxin-free feed by using adequately dried feed ingredients.

“Keep watch”

The release said that some of the texted maize samples during last week revealed high mycotoxin levels and asked farmers to keep watch during procurement and usage

of maize for feed production.

An agro advisory from Krishi Vigyan Kendra said that farmers willing to cultivate gingelly can opt for brown, black and white varieties to get high yield.
title: Feed intake of poultry to be affected
